intro: Lepidococcus huebneri, commonly known as the golden groundsel, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Lepidococcus huebneri is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support pollinator populations.
